text: I ran my own business from home for years. I was very successful. It really depends on the personality and determination the person has. I agree that there are many personality types who could not be successful working from home. I am a high D personality and will always be successful working from home. I do not appreciate the typical corporate environment. I am ok with not being salaried. Because I am highly motivated to make a lot of money if it depends on me. I don't like the back-biting and jealousy I encounter in Corporate America. I am not fresh out of college. I am sorry, but many younger people are not very motivated to work. So I understand where he is  coming from
author: @MaureenMizuno

text: I work with many young people who work hard.  What older people should understand, but many won't, is the rewards involved.  I'm in my 50s, when I started out even the crappiest office pay supported a studio apartment COMFORTABLY. The dollar lost value and does NOT stretch for them like it did for us. The 20 somethings I work with are trying to pay $1,200 per month for a dinky one bedroom apartment.  Not only is there NO rewards, but necessities are NOT affordable. They pay their bills, rent, car insurance and car payment--- and there isn't money left for food!!!  One young girl said "why should I give above and beyond when I can't feed myself after bills are paid.  Entry level pay 15 years ago and earlier allowed people to support themselves. Rent and everything else has gone way up in price.  Home ownership is extremely out of reach for them.  They have to work 1 to 2 part time jobs in addition to the 40 hour work week to do what our generation was able to do working one full time job.  We should give them grace their economy starting out is so much harder.  What is being charged for rent is terrible!!  So, since affording necessities make them have to go to a second job let them already be at home when they clock out to go to their next job.  Executives and CEOs are extremely out of touch.
author: @cloudylight2

text: How many hours in the past week were you not productive during your work day? Imagine having to pay your staff as a small business owner to do their laundry while they are on the clock. As a former small business owner, I'm certain that would have bankrupted me.
